text: Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Well, that doesn't make much sense; bees don't talk.

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Well, that doesn't make much sense; bees don't talk. You shrug it off and go about your business.

Well, that doesn't make much sense; bees don't talk. You shrug it off and go about your business. After you grab your epi pen from the drawer of course. And a flyswatter. And a can of bee spray.

You open the door and find a man in a black suit standing there. You're colorblind, so you can't really tell the color of his shirt and tie for certain, but it is definitely a bright color. He smiles at you, showing off his perfect white teeth. 

"Hello son. I've come to take you home. It's time you took up your royal duties." 

You look at him, confused. Son? As in he is claiming to be your father? Your mother never mentioned your father, or rather, she said he was a short, foreign romance and the man had left in the night to go back to his home and that was it.

You open the door and find a man in a black suit standing there. You're colorblind, so you can't really tell the color of his shirt and tie for certain, but it is definitely a bright color. He smiles at you, showing off his perfect white teeth. 

"Hello son. I've come to take you home. It's time you took up your royal duties." 

You look at him, confused. Son? As in he is claiming to be your father? Your mother never mentioned your father, or rather, she said he was a short, foreign romance and the man had left in the night to go back to his home and that was it. 

"I'm sorry sir, but you must have the wrong house." You start, because surely your father wouldn't appear like this, after 18 years. 

"No my boy, it has just taken me a while to find you, and then reach you through your mother's interference. But I am here now, and by the agreement she and I made , you are to come with me."

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Well, that doesn't make much sense; bees don't talk. You shrug it off and go about your business. After you grab your epi pen from the drawer of course. And a flyswatter. And a can of bee spray. And a baseball bat. You're not taking any chances.

You're just about to leave the house when you hear a knock at the door. You wait a moment, and then hear it again. Where was everyone today? Normally the butler or maid would have answered the door by now, or your mother would have called out at least. 

You open the door and find a man in a black suit standing there. You're colorblind, so you can't really tell the color of his shirt and tie for certain, but it is definitely a bright color. He smiles at you, showing off his perfect white teeth. 

"Hello son. I've come to take you home. It's time you took up your royal duties." 

You look at him, confused. Son? As in he is claiming to be your father? Your mother never mentioned your father, or rather, she said he was a short, foreign romance and the man had left in the night to go back to his home and that was it. 

"I'm sorry sir, but you must have the wrong house." You start, because surely your father wouldn't appear like this, after 18 years. 

"No my boy, it has just taken me a while to find you, and then reach you through your mother's interference. But I am here now, and by the agreement she and I made, you are to come with me."

Your mother came running up the, "No, please tell me you haven't spoken with him!"

But it was too late, and your fate was sealed. She told you the whole story then; how she had fallen in love with the bee king in human form, and agreed to have his child, and even agreed that the child could be the bee prince. SHe hadn't realized she would not be allowed to join you. So just before you were born she ran away and hid, and had been trying to keep you away ever since. But the agreement was binding, you had to go.

You are taken to the hive. "This is one of my palaces on the edge of my kingdom." said your father. Suddenly he changed into a bee, a large, truly majestic looking one. "Soon we will enter the main kingdom, but you you must be made presentable. Change immediately into your true form - that of the majestic bee!"

"I don't know what you are talking about; I can't transform, certainly not into a bee!"

The King raged. "No son of mine is human!"

"You are a bee, you are my son, you must transform!" Suddenly a host of bees swarmed around you. Then one approached the Bee King. "I think it is true your Majesty, we sense no bee in him. I do not think he can transform."

The King raged. "No son of mine is human!" He ordered his guards to attack you!

Your entire life, you've been told you're deathly allergic to bees. You've always had people protecting you from them, be it your mother or a hired hand. Today, one slips through and lands on your shoulder. You hear a tiny voice say "Your Majesty, what are your orders?"

Well, that doesn't make much sense; bees don't talk. You shrug it off and go about your business. After you grab your epi pen from the drawer of course. And a flyswatter. And a can of bee spray. And a baseball bat. You're not taking any chances.

You're just about to leave the house when you hear a knock at the door. You wait a moment, and then hear it again. Where was everyone today? Normally the butler or maid would have answered the door by now, or your mother would have called out at least. 

You open the door and find a man in a black suit standing there. You're colorblind, so you can't really tell the color of his shirt and tie for certain, but it is definitely a bright color. He smiles at you, showing off his perfect white teeth. 

"Hello son. I've come to take you home. It's time you took up your royal duties." 

You look at him, confused. Son? As in he is claiming to be your father? Your mother never mentioned your father, or rather, she said he was a short, foreign romance and the man had left in the night to go back to his home and that was it. 

"I'm sorry sir, but you must have the wrong house." You start, because surely your father wouldn't appear like this, after 18 years. 

"No my boy, it has just taken me a while to find you, and then reach you through your mother's interference. But I am here now, and by the agreement she and I made, you are to come with me."

Your mother came running up the, "No, please tell me you haven't spoken with him!"

But it was too late, and your fate was sealed. She told you the whole story then; how she had fallen in love with the bee king in human form, and agreed to have his child, and even agreed that the child could be the bee prince. SHe hadn't realized she would not be allowed to join you. So just before you were born she ran away and hid, and had been trying to keep you away ever since. But the agreement was binding; you had to go.

You are taken to the hive. "This is one of my palaces on the edge of my kingdom." said your father. Suddenly he changed into a bee, a large, truly majestic looking one. "Soon we will enter the main kingdom, but you you must be made presentable. Change immediately into your true form - that of the majestic bee!"

"I don't know what you are talking about; I can't transform, certainly not into a bee!" 

"You are a bee, you are my son, you must transform!" Suddenly a host of bees swarmed around you. Then one approached the Bee King. "I think it is true your Majesty, we sense no bee in him. I do not think he can transform."

The King raged. "No son of mine is human!" He ordered his guards to attack you! 

You were not a fighter, and you were outnumbered.

"Hello son. I've come to take you home. It's time you took up your royal duties." 

You look at him, confused. Son? As in he is claiming to be your father? Your mother never mentioned your father, or rather, she said he was a short, foreign romance and the man had left in the night to go back to his home and that was it.

But it was too late, and your fate was sealed. She told you the whole story then; how she had fallen in love with the bee king in human form, and agreed to have his child, and even agreed that the child could be the bee prince. SHe hadn't realized she would not be allowed to join you. So just before you were born she ran away and hid, and had been trying to keep you away ever since. But the agreement was binding; you had to go.

You are taken to the hive. "This is one of my palaces on the edge of my kingdom." said your father. Suddenly he changed into a bee, a large, truly majestic looking one. "Soon we will enter the main kingdom, but you you must be made presentable. Change immediately into your true form - that of the majestic bee!"

"I don't know what you are talking about; I can't transform, certainly not into a bee!" 

"You are a bee, you are my son, you must transform!" Suddenly a host of bees swarmed around you. Then one approached the Bee King. "I think it is true your Majesty, we sense no bee in him. I do not think he can transform."

The King raged. "No son of mine is human!" He ordered his guards to attack you! 

You were not a fighter, and you were outnumbered. But then you remembered; you still had the can of bee spray in your hand! You started spraying all around you, spinning. 

"Your Majesty we must retreat!" squeaked one bee as it fell. The king buzzed angrily. "I denounce you, you are no son of mine and an enemy of bees forever!"

And with that you returned home, and told your mother the story. She wept with happiness, and you both began planning your new life. THe first thing you needed to do was move somewhere without bees. But that is another story.
